{{#tree: extensions=["persist"] | 
* [{{fullurl:Main Page}} Main Page] 
}}

This page is a system page. It controls what is shown in the Categories portion of the sidebar. The contents of this page must conform to the following rules: * The page contains a single <pre> ... </pre> area. * This area contains a JSON data string of type array. * The array contains objects of one of the following types: ** {"root": , "depth": } ** {"name": } ** Every object may contain an optional "style" key whose value is a CSS string. ** Every object may contain an optional "classname" field whose value refers to a class name known to the system 
[
  {"root": "Root", "depth":4},
  {"name": "Example", "style": "color:red;"},
  {"name": "Testpage", "style": "color:green;"}
]

revision.comment: Autogenerated DynamicPageList3's necessary template for content inclusion.
revision.text: <noinclude>This page was automatically created. It serves as an anchor page for all '''[[Special:WhatLinksHere/Template:Extension_DPL|invocations]]''' of [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Extension:DynamicPageList3 Extension:DynamicPageList3].</noinclude>

{{Special:Prefixindex/{{{1|{{#if: {{#translation:}}|{{BASEPAGENAMEE}}|{{FULLPAGENAMEE}} }}}}}/ |hideredirects=1 |translate-hidetranslations={{if:{{{showtranslations|}}}|0|1}} }}
{{documentation|content= {{documentation subpage}} ===Usage=== {{subpages}} shows all the subpages of a given page. It should not be used in the main namespace, only on pages such as user pages, Wiktionary pages and appendices. It takes one, optional parameter, the target page name. The default is {{PAGENAME}} * {{subpages}}: shows the subpages for the current page (in this case, Template:subpages) * {{subpages|User:Example}}: shows the subpages for [[User:Example]] == Alternative == You can also embed the [[Special:PrefixIndex]] directly, e.g. {{Special:Prefixindex|prefix=User:Example/|hideredirects=1|stripprefix=1}} If you want use in your wiki a sorted lists of subpages, or get counts of it for using in templates, you may try extension {{ll|Extension:SubPageList}}. Example using of this, see wiki code of template [https://www.thewoodcraft.org/wiki/index.php?title=%C5%A0ablona:pages&action=edit Template:pages]. It's alternative solution without tag {{tag|pages|open}} for pages of books from the {{ll|Extension:ProofreadPage}}. This template generate i.e. content of page [https://www.thewoodcraft.org/wiki/index.php/The_Birch-Bark_Roll_1906_(kniha) The Birch-Bark Roll 1906 (kniha)]. It is solution '''without''' dependency on the [[Lua]] modules. }}
